titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the The Francis Robinson Collection

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this addendum includes color lithographs, plates and articles relating to the work of Alphonse Mucha (b. 1860 in South Morovia), whose artwork ranged from jewelry, posters, furniture, and household objects. At the forefront of the Art Noveau movement (roughly 1890s — 1920), Mucha rose to prominence in both the art and theatrical world through his association with actress Sarah Bernhardt (1844 — 1923), for whom he designed a series of beautifully illustrated posters to advertise and promote her plays. Additionally, Mucha also designed sets, costumes and personal items for the legendary stage actress.

A second component of this collection consists of prints from Vanity Fair magazine from the "Men of the Day" and "Women of Genius" Series, featuring Bernhardt, Jean De Reszke, and Signor Pietro Mascagni.
